data_tapor: {"id":1180,"user_id":1,"name":"RefWorks","detail":"\u003cp\u003eRefWorks allows users to create personal databases and use them for a variety of research activities. References are quickly and easily imported from text files or online databases. The databases can then be used to manage, store, and share the information. Users can automatically insert references from their database into their papers and generate formatted bibliographies and manuscripts in seconds.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eRefWorks allows you to…\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eOrganize and create a personal database online – no more index cards to write out and organize. Everything is done automatically as you import the reference into RefWorks.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFormat bibliographies and manuscripts in seconds – this saves hours of typing time and decreases the number of errors in creating tedious bibliographies. Easily make changes to your paper and reformat in seconds.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eImport references from a variety of databases using the already created Import Filters.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eManage Alerts – RefWorks has incorporated a RSS feed reader to allow you to establish links to your favorite RSS feeds and import data from those feeds directly into RefWorks.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSearching your RefWorks database is fast and easy – RefWorks automatically creates author, descriptor and periodical indexes when importing so you just click on the word to perform the retrieval. Use Quick Search to search all fields for the most comprehensive results or Advanced Search to narrow your search to specific terms and fields.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1180.jpg","creators_name":"ProQuest","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.refworks.com/","last_updated":"2018-10-19","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1180-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: RefWorks allows users to create personal databases and use them for a variety of research activities. References are quickly and easily imported from text files or online databases. The databases can then be used to manage, store, and share the information. Users can automatically insert references from their database into their papers and generate formatted bibliographies and manuscripts in seconds.RefWorks allows you to…Organize and create a personal database online – no more index cards to write out and organize. Everything is done automatically as you import the reference into RefWorks.Format bibliographies and manuscripts in seconds – this saves hours of typing time and decreases the number of errors in creating tedious bibliographies. Easily make changes to your paper and reformat in seconds.Import references from a variety of databases using the already created Import Filters.Manage Alerts – RefWorks has incorporated a RSS feed reader to allow you to establish links to your favorite RSS feeds and import data from those feeds directly into RefWorks.Searching your RefWorks database is fast and easy – RefWorks automatically creates author, descriptor and periodical indexes when importing so you just click on the word to perform the retrieval. Use Quick Search to search all fields for the most comprehensive results or Advanced Search to narrow your search to specific terms and fields.
name: RefWorks

data_tapor: {"id":1185,"user_id":1,"name":"NoodleTools","detail":"\u003cp\u003eMLA, APA, Chicago / Turabian and most-common Bluebook forms as an integrated citing and note-taking platform for individual or group projects. detail: MLA, APA, Chicago / Turabian and most-common Bluebook forms as an integrated citing and note-taking platform for individual or group projects.  Prompts for analysis of source types and is unique in offering teaching support and personal help on any citation. Dashboard provides long-term access to a portfolio of work.NoodleTools MLA Lite is a free version with a Bibliography component and limited set of citation types appropriate for elementary or middle-school students.
name: NoodleTools

detail:
BibTeX has been widely in use since its introduction by Oren Patashnik 20 years ago. As the name suggests, it was intended to be used in combination with the typesetting system LaTeX, but it has become possible, for instance, to include BibTeX-bibliographies even in Word-Documents using third-party tools.
BibTeX utilizes a plain-text file-format which can be created and modified using an arbitrary text-editor by the user. There are tools in existence which provide a more convenient UI.
name: BibText

data_tapor: {"id":1190,"user_id":1,"name":"Bookends","detail":"\u003cp\u003eReference management entails the collection, annotation, curation, and citation of published information. Bookends simplifies these tasks. Bookends can perform Internet searches to retrieve references and associated pdfs or web pages, or immediately find and import references for which you already have the pdf. Versatile groups (static, smart, and virtual), term lists (keywords, authors, etc.), reference cross-linking (links), multiple notecards per reference, PDF annotation, tag clouds, and instantaneous live searches help organize and find information in your personal collection. Highly configurable displays let you view the reference information and attachments the way you want. Scan your word processor manuscripts to create publication-ready documents complete with bibliographies and footnotes. Sync references and pdfs in your library with your iPhone, iPod Touch, or iPad (requires separate purchase of Bookends On Tap from the iTunes App Store). Create and edit PDF annotations and highlighted text, which instantly appear as Bookends notecards. And much more. Compatible with Microsoft Word, Mellel (including Live Bibliography, updating of citations and bibliographies as you type), Apple Pages '08, ’09, and (provisionally) Pages 5, Nisus Writer Pro, and OpenOffice 3.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1190.jpg","creators_name":"Sonny Software","creators_email":null,"creators_url":"https://www.sonnysoftware.com/","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.sonnysoftware.com/","last_updated":"2018-10-26","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1190-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}

As of version 1.4, Bibus is available in English, Chinese, Czech, French, German, Hungarian, Portuguese, Slovenian, Spanish.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1191.jpg","creators_name":"Pierre Martineau","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"http://bibus-biblio.sourceforge.net/wiki/index.php/Bibus_bibliographic_database","last_updated":"2018-10-26","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1191-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}

In addition, Bibus contains features that makes it unique among open source and even commercial bibliographic databases:Hierarchical organization of the references with user defined keysDesigned for multiuser environmentsDatabase sharing among an "unlimited" number of usersIndividual classification for each userAbility to define read-only and read-write usersLive queries; that is searches that update as the database changesOnline PubMed queriesOnline eTBLAST queriesInsertion of references and formatting of bibliographies into three widely used Word Processors (LibreOffice.org,OpenOffice.org and Microsoft Word)Foreign language support through Unicode and gettext. data_tapor: {"id":1204,"user_id":1,"name":"Collation Works","detail":"\u003cp\u003eCollateX-based text collation client. CollateX, run on an server independent from the URL above, is a powerful, fully automatic, baseless text collation engine for multiple witnesses. A second collation technique, ncritic, provides a slightly different baseless text collation. Each engine complements each other nicely. The user can use different files, even URLs, then output the result in GraphML, TEI, JSON, HTML, or SVG. Fuzzy matching is an option.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/missing.jpg","creators_name":"Interedition","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":null,"last_updated":null,"nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/missing-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: CollateX-based text collation client. CollateX, run on an server independent from the URL above, is a powerful, fully automatic, baseless text collation engine for multiple witnesses. A second collation technique, ncritic, provides a slightly different baseless text collation. Each engine complements each other nicely. The user can use different files, even URLs, then output the result in GraphML, TEI, JSON, HTML, or SVG. Fuzzy matching is an option.
name: Collation Works

data_tapor: {"id":1205,"user_id":1,"name":"digilib","detail":"\u003cp\u003eDigilib is a web based client/server technology for images. The image content is processed on-the-fly by a Java Servlet on the server side so that only the visible portion of the image is sent to the web browser on the client side. It supports a wide range of image formats and viewing options on the server side while only requiring an internet browser with javascript and a low bandwidth internet connection on the client side. digilib enables very detailed work on an image as required by scientists with elaborate zoom features like an option to show images on the screen in their original size. digilib facilitates cooperation of scientists over the internet and novel uses of source material by image annotations and stable references that can be embedded in URLs. digilib is used in the ALCATRAZ framework of image, text and annotation tools and many other projects.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1205.jpg","creators_name":"Robert Casties and Martin Raspe","creators_email":"robcast@users.sourceforge.net","creators_url":"","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://sourceforge.net/projects/digilib/","last_updated":"2022-02-03","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"https://github.com/robcast/digilib","thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1205-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Digilib is a web based client/server technology for images. The image content is processed on-the-fly by a Java Servlet on the server side so that only the visible portion of the image is sent to the web browser on the client side. It supports a wide range of image formats and viewing options on the server side while only requiring an internet browser with javascript and a low bandwidth internet connection on the client side. digilib enables very detailed work on an image as required by scientists with elaborate zoom features like an option to show images on the screen in their original size. digilib facilitates cooperation of scientists over the internet and novel uses of source material by image annotations and stable references that can be embedded in URLs. digilib is used in the ALCATRAZ framework of image, text and annotation tools and many other projects.
name: digilib

data_tapor: {"id":1206,"user_id":1,"name":"T-PEN (Transcription for Paleographical and Editorial Notation)","detail":"\u003cp\u003eExtensive set of tools to allow collaborative transcription of manuscript pages in TEI-compliant XML.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFeatures of T-PEN through version 1.2 [from project blog]\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eZoom Tool in Transcription User Interface: Holding CTRL+SHIFT will result in a magnified image of the current line being transcribed.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eMagnifying Tool in Full Page View: Click on \"Magnify\" button at the top right of the browser window and a magnifying glass tool will appear as the mouse pointer. Click on the same button to dismiss the tool. The magnifying tool is also available in the Compare Page feature.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eCreate a Project “Pipeline” to the outer world: In partnership with The Carolingian Canon Law Project (CCL), T-PEN developed a model for enabling users working on transcription projects in T-PEN to export their work to a larger, external project. In this instance, the CCL prepared for T-PEN an XML-markup template (XML button set) that may be used for all transcriptions destined for the CCL database. Users identify their T-PEN projects as destined for the CCL, and when the transcription is complete, they can submit it from T-PEN to the CCL project. The CCL receives notification of the stable URL in T-PEN that the CCL can (either manually or by automation) use to extract the designated transcription from T-PEN’s data store. Other projects interested in creating their own pipeline should contact T-PEN via t-pen.org\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eT-PEN Administration: T-PEN administrator can clear registration requests that have not been approved (ones that were mostly generated through internal testing).\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eTranscription UI: The previous line text will scale to the size of the screen. When on the first line of the page, available text from the last line of the previous page will be shown.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eVisual Cue for Closing Tag Proximity (Transcription UI): Closing tags originating on previous pages are faded to indicate their distance from the current line of transcription.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eTranscription Preview: The preview tool now applies a simple color filter to  to allow for a more clear view of your transcription.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eNew Project Option Tools: Users can add a French/English dictionary, a dictionary for Middle English and the Dictionary of Old English (subscription required). User can select which tools will be available in the Transcription UI’s i-frame. All tools can also be renamed by the user on the project management page.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eExporting Transcriptions: When exporting xml, users can select or deselect all the tags for inclusion at once.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eLine History (Versioning): T-PEN distinguishes between all versions of any transcription line. Users can view previous versions of a given line. A change in a line is defined as addition or deletion of a single character (including white space) or modifications to the line parsing coordinates. A previous version can be selected to replace the current version. All versioning activity is recorded in the project log, which can be viewed on the project management page under the Collaboration tab.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1206.jpg","creators_name":"Center for Digital Theology at Saint Louis University","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"http://www.t-pen.org/TPEN/","last_updated":"2018-10-12","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1206-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
name_tapor-api: T-PEN (Transcription for Paleographical and Editorial Notation)

Click on the same button to dismiss the tool. The magnifying tool is also available in the Compare Page feature.Create a Project “Pipeline” to the outer world: In partnership with The Carolingian Canon Law Project (CCL), T-PEN developed a model for enabling users working on transcription projects in T-PEN to export their work to a larger, external project. In this instance, the CCL prepared for T-PEN an XML-markup template (XML button set) that may be used for all transcriptions destined for the CCL database. Users identify their T-PEN projects as destined for the CCL, and when the transcription is complete, they can submit it from T-PEN to the CCL project. The CCL receives notification of the stable URL in T-PEN that the CCL can (either manually or by automation) use to extract the designated transcription from T-PEN’s data store. Other projects interested in creating their own pipeline should contact T-PEN via t-pen.orgT-PEN Administration: T-PEN administrator can clear registration requests that have not been approved (ones that were mostly generated through internal testing).Transcription UI: The previous line text will scale to the size of the screen. When on the first line of the page, available text from the last line of the previous page will be shown.Visual Cue for Closing Tag Proximity (Transcription UI): Closing tags originating on previous pages are faded to indicate their distance from the current line of transcription.Transcription Preview: The preview tool now applies a simple color filter to  to allow for a more clear view of your transcription.New Project Option Tools: Users can add a French/English dictionary, a dictionary for Middle English and the Dictionary of Old English (subscription required). User can select which tools will be available in the Transcription UI’s i-frame. All tools can also be renamed by the user on the project management page.Exporting Transcriptions: When exporting xml, users can select or deselect all the tags for inclusion at once.Line History (Versioning): T-PEN distinguishes between all versions of any transcription line. Users can view previous versions of a given line. A change in a line is defined as addition or deletion of a single character (including white space) or modifications to the line parsing coordinates. A previous version can be selected to replace the current version. All versioning activity is recorded in the project log, which can be viewed on the project management page under the Collaboration tab.
name: T-PEN (Transcription for Paleographical and Editorial Notation)

data_tapor: {"id":1210,"user_id":1,"name":"MySQL","detail":"\u003cp\u003eA software application that enables relational databases to be created, managed and queried. detail: A software application that enables a user to search, manipulate and publish large SGML/XML documents. Anastasia was developed within an academic context to enable the manipulation of a single, large mark-up documents or a set of documents. It utilises two methods to interpret the structure of a mark-up document: First, it uses pattern-matching algorithms to process a hierarchical tree, similar to other XML software applications; Second, it interprets the document structure as a series of sequential 'events' which must be processed. The latter method, it is indicated, enables the application to perform processing activities that are difficult or impossible using the traditional approach. For example, it is able to build a view of textual content across element divisions and in different types of hiearchical structure and to allow the easy publication of user defined extracts from complex documents.Features: Pattern-matching algorithms to process a hierarchical treeEvent-driven analysis to manipulate information stored across element boundaries and contained in semi-structured or unstructured text mark-up
name: Anastasia

data_tapor: {"id":1213,"user_id":1,"name":"OmniPage","detail":"\u003cp\u003eA software tool capable of performing Optical Character Recognition (OCR) upon a set of images. It was one of the first OCR recognition software to be developed. It was developed in the late 1980s and sold by Caere Corporation. It is currently owned by  Kofax Inc. It achieves the task by analysing pixel sets and in an image and cross-matching them to a dictionary of words. Omnipage automates large sections of the digitisation process enabling physical objects to be scanned, processed using the OCR software and exported to a document file format. Later versions of the software incorporate image enhancement features to improve scan quality (and recognition results) and better support for complex page layouts and forms.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFeatures: \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eIntegration with scanning software\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eMaintain layout of captured document\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1213.jpg","creators_name":"Kofax Inc.","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.kofax.com/products/omnipage","last_updated":"2021-12-09","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1213-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: A software tool capable of performing Optical Character Recognition (OCR) upon a set of images. It was one of the first OCR recognition software to be developed. data_tapor: {"id":1219,"user_id":1,"name":"CLAWS Tagger","detail":"\u003cp\u003ePart-of-Speech (POS) tagging software for English - the classification of words into one or more categories based upon its definition, relationship with other words, or other context, also known as wordclass tagging. CLAWS (Constituent Likelihood Automatic Word-tagging System) uses several methods to identify parts of speech., most notably a system called Hidden Markov models (HMMs) which involve counting examples of co-occurrence of words and wordclasses in training data and making a table of the probabilities of certain sequences of words.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFeatures: \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eParts-of-Speech tagging with an accuracy rate of approximately 96-97 percent for text analyzed for common text types in British English.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eTemplate tagging\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eA free version is CLAWS is scheduled for release in 2015.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1219.jpg","creators_name":"University Centre for Computer Corpus Research on Language (UCREL), University of Lancaster","creators_email":"","creators_url":"http://ucrel.lancs.ac.uk/","star_average":0.0,"url":"http://ucrel.lancs.ac.uk/claws/","last_updated":"2018-10-05","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1219-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Part-of-Speech (POS) tagging software for English - the classification of words into one or more categories based upon its definition, relationship with other words, or other context, also known as wordclass tagging. CLAWS (Constituent Likelihood Automatic Word-tagging System) uses several methods to identify parts of speech., most notably a system called Hidden Markov models (HMMs) which involve counting examples of co-occurrence of words and wordclasses in training data and making a table of the probabilities of certain sequences of words.Features: Parts-of-Speech tagging with an accuracy rate of approximately 96-97 percent for text analyzed for common text types in British English.Template taggingA free version is CLAWS is scheduled for release in 2015.

data_tapor: {"id":1220,"user_id":1,"name":"SoundScriber","detail":"\u003cp\u003eA software application for the playback of audio recordings. SoundScriber offers specific functionality for researchers that wish to transcribe a recording. It was originally developed for use in the Michigan Corpus of Academic Spoken English (MICASE) project and released for use by academics performing similar work.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFeatures: \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAudio playback via installed audio codecs (e.g. Wav, MP3)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eVariable speed playback\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e'Walking' support – playback of a small stretch of an audio stream several times to ensure accurate transcription is made, followed by an advancement to a new section of audio.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1220.jpg","creators_name":"University of Michigan","creators_email":"ebreck@umich.edu","creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"http://www-personal.umich.edu/~ebreck/code/sscriber/","last_updated":"2021-12-03","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"http://www-personal.umich.edu/~ebreck/data/sscriber/sscriber-source.tgz","thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1220-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: A software application for the playback of audio recordings. SoundScriber offers specific functionality for researchers that wish to transcribe a recording. It was originally developed for use in the Michigan Corpus of Academic Spoken English (MICASE) project and released for use by academics performing similar work.Features: Audio playback via installed audio codecs (e.g. Wav, MP3)Variable speed playback'Walking' support – playback of a small stretch of an audio stream several times to ensure accurate transcription is made, followed by an advancement to a new section of audio.
name: SoundScriber

data_tapor: {"id":1221,"user_id":1,"name":"Fedora Commons","detail":"\u003cp\u003eFedora (Flexible Extensible Digital Object Repository Architecture) was originally developed by researchers at Cornell University as an architecture to store, manage, and access digital content in the form of digital objects. Fedora defines a set of abstractions for expressing digital objects, asserting relationships among digital objects, and linking behaviors to digital objects. Developed by the community and stewarded by Duraspace —  a nonprofit involved with open source technology projects including VIVO and DSpace — Fedora Commons implements the Fedora abstractions in an open source, modular repository system for managing and disseminating digital content. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFedora Commons is widely used in the academic sector as a basis for digital libraries, archives, or repository systems. Its worldwide installed user base includes academic and cultural heritage organizations, universities, research institutions, university libraries, national libraries, government agencies, and more.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eManagement and maintenance of any digital content type and of metadata about content in any format\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eScale to millions of objects\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAccess data via APIs (REST/SOAP)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eProvide RDF search (SPARQL)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eRebuilder utility (for disaster recovery and data migration)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eEntire repository can be rebuilt from the digital object and content files\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eContent model architecture (define \"types\" of objects by their content)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eMany storage options (database and file systems)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eJMS messaging (your apps can \"listen\" to repository events)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWeb-based administrator GUI (low-level object editing)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eOAI-PMH provider service\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eGSearch (fulltext) search service\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eMultiple, customer driven front-ends\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1221.jpg","creators_name":"Duraspace","creators_email":null,"creators_url":"https://duraspace.org/","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://duraspace.org/fedora/","last_updated":"2018-10-12","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"https://wiki.duraspace.org/display/FF","thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1221-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Fedora (Flexible Extensible Digital Object Repository Architecture) was originally developed by researchers at Cornell University as an architecture to store, manage, and access digital content in the form of digital objects. Fedora defines a set of abstractions for expressing digital objects, asserting relationships among digital objects, and linking behaviors to digital objects. Developed by the community and stewarded by Duraspace —  a nonprofit involved with open source technology projects including VIVO and DSpace — Fedora Commons implements the Fedora abstractions in an open source, modular repository system for managing and disseminating digital content. Fedora Commons is widely used in the academic sector as a basis for digital libraries, archives, or repository systems. Its worldwide installed user base includes academic and cultural heritage organizations, universities, research institutions, university libraries, national libraries, government agencies, and more.Management and maintenance of any digital content type and of metadata about content in any formatScale to millions of objectsAccess data via APIs (REST/SOAP)Provide RDF search (SPARQL)Rebuilder utility (for disaster recovery and data migration)Entire repository can be rebuilt from the digital object and content filesContent model architecture (define "types" of objects by their content)Many storage options (database and file systems)JMS messaging (your apps can "listen" to repository events)Web-based administrator GUI (low-level object editing)OAI-PMH provider serviceGSearch (fulltext) search serviceMultiple, customer driven front-ends
name: Fedora Commons

detail: A structured text editor that may be used to create, edit, validate and convert XML and SGML documents. EpcEdit contains an integrated validating parser, an editor for CALS and HTML tables, an attribute editor and an element manipulation tool.Features: XML/SGML parser with full support of Oasis SGML-Open catalog filesDocument structure mapping, enabling users to visualise the construction of an XML/SGML document without a DTDAttribute editor that supports conformance checking of attribute values and has special support for ID and IDREF attributesConfigurable user interface that may be integrated with other tools through use of Tcl programming language

detail: A statistical package that may be used to compare quantified assemblages of broken and incomplete objects, such as ceramics, glass and bones. Pie-Slice uses Estimated Vessel Equivalent (EVE) as a base form of measurement, in which each measurable fraction is scored as a fraction of a complete vessel. It also trials the use of a new statistical transformation - the pseudo-count transformation - which converts EVEs into Pottery Information Equivalents (PIEs). The latter enables assemblages to be compared using techniques such as log-linear and correspondence analyses. The resultant output is visualised through the use of GNUPlot.Features: User-defined variables that may be tailored to specifics of the object being describedVisual depiction of the relationship between assemblage variables (e.g. pottery forms), which may be used to evaluate their statistical significance
name: Pie-Slice

data_tapor: {"id":1227,"user_id":1,"name":"Asset Bank","detail":"\u003cp\u003eA digital asset management system for the storage, management and delivery of raster images, audiovisual content, documents and other digital asset types. The software provides limited eCommerce functionality for use by institutions that wish to use the system to sell digital products. It may be installed in-house on a Windows/Linux/Unix system or hosted on a system operated by the developers.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAsset storage can be customized to suit the needs of your project on server hard disk, network or SAN, cloud storage via Amazon or Rackspace, via Box accounts, or stored as BLOBs in your database.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003ePricing quotes are available through the product website. Asset Bank offers active customer support including guided demos, customized quotes, monthly webinars, a knowledge base, in depth documentation, and a support ticket system. This resource is ideal for large Enterprises and supports multi-lingual configuration, organisational units, and LDAP integration. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFeatures: \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eImage versioning\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eUser-driven rating system\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAutomatic generation of thumbnails and preview images\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eRapid downloading of files in a range of formats\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSearch or browse by keywords and popularity\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eMonitor \u0026amp; control asset usage\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eBrand guidelines to provide consistent access to project/organization logos, colours, etc\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eMetadata batch edit\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eDate validation\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eMetadata import in XML or other delimited formats\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003econfigure and customize almost all aspects of the interface\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003ePremium Features: \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eDocument Editor Plug-in for desktop applications used to edit common file types (.doc, Photoshop \u0026amp; InDesign file formats)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eVideo Keywording module allows you to link keyword metadata to points of time in a video asset\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003ePresentation Builder module maintains project presentation slides in Asset Bank, creates master presentation sets including slides that can be shared and reused\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1227.jpg","creators_name":"Bright Interactive","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.assetbank.co.uk/","last_updated":"2018-10-25","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1227-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}

data_tapor: {"id":1228,"user_id":1,"name":"TurnTool","detail":"\u003cp\u003eTurnTool is a suite of tools that enable 3D models to be created and viewed in a low-bandwidth environment. The suite consists of two components: a TurnToolBox plug-in for integration with 3D Studio Max, Autodesk Viz, Cinema4D and ArchiCAD that allows these software applications to export objects into the TurnTool format; and a TurnTable Viewer plug-in that is able to recreate the 3D model in a windowed environment or web browser.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFeatures: \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e3D modelling\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eActiveX viewer\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eLow bandwidth use\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1228.jpg","creators_name":"TurnTool ApS","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"http://www.turntool.com/","last_updated":"2021-11-16","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1228-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: TurnTool is a suite of tools that enable 3D models to be created and viewed in a low-bandwidth environment. The suite consists of two components: a TurnToolBox plug-in for integration with 3D Studio Max, Autodesk Viz, Cinema4D and ArchiCAD that allows these software applications to export objects into the TurnTool format; and a TurnTable Viewer plug-in that is able to recreate the 3D model in a windowed environment or web browser.Features: 3D modellingActiveX viewerLow bandwidth use

data_tapor: {"id":1230,"user_id":1,"name":"CHET-C","detail":"\u003cp\u003eCHET-C, or Chapel Hill Electronic Text-Converter, is a browser based software tool designed to convert digital texts that employ standard epigraphic conventions such as the Leiden sigla into EpiDoc-compliant XML files. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThe tool can be accessed online at http://www.stoa.org/projects/epidoc/stable/chetc-js/chetc.html. Fragments of epigraphic text using standard sigla (eg Leiden convention markup) are pasted into the tool and Epidoc compliant XML is generated.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003ePrior versions exist (MSAccess + VBA and Java, both now deprecated) for use by those without stabel web access or who wish to customise the underlying regular expressions to process non standard sigla\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1230.jpg","creators_name":"EpiDoc Collaborative","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"http://cds.library.brown.edu/projects/chet-c/chetc.html","last_updated":"2021-09-09","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1230-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: CHET-C, or Chapel Hill Electronic Text-Converter, is a browser based software tool designed to convert digital texts that employ standard epigraphic conventions such as the Leiden sigla into EpiDoc-compliant XML files. The tool can be accessed online at http://www.stoa.org/projects/epidoc/stable/chetc-js/chetc.html. Fragments of epigraphic text using standard sigla (eg Leiden convention markup) are pasted into the tool and Epidoc compliant XML is generated.Prior versions exist (MSAccess + VBA and Java, both now deprecated) for use by those without stabel web access or who wish to customise the underlying regular expressions to process non standard sigla
name: CHET-C

data_tapor: {"id":1234,"user_id":1,"name":"Zoomify","detail":"\u003cp\u003eA suite of products developed for web designers that may be used to convert large images into a form that can be zoomed and panned. Zoomify enables large images to be viewed and manipulated, without an increase in server load or download time. It converts large images stored in raster formats (e.g. TIFF, JPEG) into a set of pieces or 'tiles' The individual pieces contain sub-sections of the image at different resolutions or levels of zoom, which are combined to create a type of mosaic.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFeatures: \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eEnables access to high quality still images without an increase in server load\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1234.jpg","creators_name":"Zoomify Inc.","creators_email":"support@zoomify.com","creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"http://www.zoomify.com/","last_updated":"2021-09-09","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1234-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: A suite of products developed for web designers that may be used to convert large images into a form that can be zoomed and panned. Zoomify enables large images to be viewed and manipulated, without an increase in server load or download time. It converts large images stored in raster formats (e.g. TIFF, JPEG) into a set of pieces or 'tiles' The individual pieces contain sub-sections of the image at different resolutions or levels of zoom, which are combined to create a type of mosaic.Features: Enables access to high quality still images without an increase in server load

data_tapor: {"id":1249,"user_id":1,"name":"Apache Subversion Version System (SVN)","detail":"\u003cp\u003eApache Subversion Version System (SVN) is an open source version control system. Access and revision to objects are carefully controlled, to prevent unauthorized access and alteration. Developers use SVN to maintain current and historical versions of files such as source code, web pages, and documentation. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eTheir Vision: \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSubversion exists to be universally recognized and adopted as an open-source, centralized version control system characterized by its reliability as a safe haven for valuable data; the simplicity of its model and usage; and its ability to support the needs of a wide variety of users and projects, from individuals to large-scale enterprise operations.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFeatures:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eVersion support for all files and directories in repository, enabling administrator to track changes that have occurred and obtain earlier versions of files\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eRenamed/copied/moved/removed files retain full revision history\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFree-form versioned metadata\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAtomic commits\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eMerge tracking\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFile locking\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eChangelists to organize commits into commit groups\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003ePreservation of file attributes, such as executable and read/write status\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eApache network server support with WebDAV/DeltaV protocol\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWrite-through proxy using WebDAV\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eInteractive conflict resolution\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e Repository read-only mirroring\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eParsable output, including XML log output\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e Full MIME support - users can view or change the MIME type of each file, with the software knowing which MIME types can have their differences from previous versions shown\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1249.jpg","creators_name":"Apache Software Foundation","creators_email":null,"creators_url":"https://www.apache.org/","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://subversion.apache.org/","last_updated":"2018-10-19","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"https://subversion.apache.org/download.cgi?update=201708081800","thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1249-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Apache Subversion Version System (SVN) is an open source version control system. Access and revision to objects are carefully controlled, to prevent unauthorized access and alteration. Developers use SVN to maintain current and historical versions of files such as source code, web pages, and documentation. Their Vision: Subversion exists to be universally recognized and adopted as an open-source, centralized version control system characterized by its reliability as a safe haven for valuable data; the simplicity of its model and usage; and its ability to support the needs of a wide variety of users and projects, from individuals to large-scale enterprise operations.Features:Version support for all files and directories in repository, enabling administrator to track changes that have occurred and obtain earlier versions of filesRenamed/copied/moved/removed files retain full revision historyFree-form versioned metadataAtomic commitsMerge trackingFile lockingChangelists to organize commits into commit groupsPreservation of file attributes, such as executable and read/write statusApache network server support with WebDAV/DeltaV protocolWrite-through proxy using WebDAVInteractive conflict resolution Repository read-only mirroringParsable output, including XML log output Full MIME support - users can view or change the MIME type of each file, with the software knowing which MIME types can have their differences from previous versions shown
name: Apache Subversion

data_tapor: {"id":1250,"user_id":1,"name":"Adobe Dreamweaver","detail":"\u003cp\u003eA visual development tool for creating, publishing, and managing websites and mobile content: Dreamweaver offers a graphics-based WYSIWYG (What You See Is What You GET pronounced wizzywig) and code-based user interface for the development of web pages and sites. The tool may be used to simplify the process of web site development (in comparison to creation of individual web pages), through the provision of a templating system that allows single-source update of shared code and layout across entire sites without server-side includes or scripting.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFeatures: \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWYSIWYG\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e  \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eCode hinting for Ajax and JavaScript frameworks\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e  \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSubversion integration\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e  \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFTP/SFTP support\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e  \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWebDav support\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e  \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWeb site template system\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e  \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAdobe Spry AJAX framework support\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1250.jpg","creators_name":"Adobe Systems Incorporated","creators_email":null,"creators_url":"https://www.adobe.com/","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.adobe.com/ca/products/dreamweaver.html","last_updated":"2018-09-18","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1250-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: A visual development tool for creating, publishing, and managing websites and mobile content: Dreamweaver offers a graphics-based WYSIWYG (What You See Is What You GET pronounced wizzywig) and code-based user interface for the development of web pages and sites. The tool may be used to simplify the process of web site development (in comparison to creation of individual web pages), through the provision of a templating system that allows single-source update of shared code and layout across entire sites without server-side includes or scripting.Features: WYSIWYG  Code hinting for Ajax and JavaScript frameworks  Subversion integration  FTP/SFTP support  WebDav support  Web site template system  Adobe Spry AJAX framework support
name: Adobe Dreamweaver

{"id":1252,"user_id":1,"name":"Perl","detail":"Perl is a high-level, general-purpose, interpreted, dynamic programming language. Originally developed for text manipulation, it is now used for a wide range of tasks including graphics programming, system administration, network programming, applications that require database access and CGI programming on the Web.

Features:

- C, shell scripting (sh), AWK, and sed

- Powerful text processing facilities

- Flexibility and adaptability

-Support for multiple programming paradigms

-Reference counting memory management

","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1252.jpg","creators_name":"The Perl Foundation","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.perl.org/","last_updated":"2018-09-18","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"https://github.com/Perl/perl5","thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1252-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail:
Perl is a high-level, general-purpose, interpreted, dynamic programming language. Originally developed for text manipulation, it is now used for a wide range of tasks including graphics programming, system administration, network programming, applications that require database access and CGI programming on the Web.

Features:

- C, shell scripting (sh), AWK, and sed

- Powerful text processing facilities

- Flexibility and adaptability

-Support for multiple programming paradigms

-Reference counting memory management
name: Perl

data_tapor: {"id":1254,"user_id":1,"name":"ArcGIS","detail":"\u003cp\u003eArcGIS is a suite of software that comprises of Desktop GIS, Server GIS, Mobile GIS, and ArcGIS Online. ArcGIS is a platform for building a complete geographic information system (GIS) that lets you easily create, edit, and analyse geographic knowledge on the desktop; publish data, maps, globes and models to a GIS server and/or share them online; and use them on the desktop, on the Web, or in the field.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFeatures: \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eView and query maps\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eManipulate shapefiles and geodatabases\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eData manipulation, editing and analysis\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eMobile device enabled\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1254.jpg","creators_name":"Environmental Systems Research Institute (ESRI)","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.esri.com/zh-cn/arcgis/products/arcgis-online/overview","last_updated":"2018-09-27","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1254-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: ArcGIS is a suite of software that comprises of Desktop GIS, Server GIS, Mobile GIS, and ArcGIS Online. ArcGIS is a platform for building a complete geographic information system (GIS) that lets you easily create, edit, and analyse geographic knowledge on the desktop; publish data, maps, globes and models to a GIS server and/or share them online; and use them on the desktop, on the Web, or in the field.Features: View and query mapsManipulate shapefiles and geodatabasesData manipulation, editing and analysisMobile device enabled

data_tapor: {"id":1255,"user_id":1,"name":"Autodesk 3ds Max","detail":"\u003cp\u003eAutodesk 3ds Max (formerly 3D Studio MAX) is an open source graphics software tool used by video game developers, motion picture studios and architectural visualisers for modelling and animation projects. data_tapor: {"id":1262,"user_id":1,"name":"Google Books","detail":"\u003cp\u003eGoogle Books provides full, free PDF scans (and web-viewable versions) of public domain books and magazines, free previews of some books and magazines under copyright, and the option to purchase digital editions of available items to save and read on Google Play, their e-reading platform. You can also find a local library based on your zip code that has the item available. Reader reviews of the items are available and you can contribute your own. Search for authors, titles, as well as keywords and Google will return results with matches in the title/text of the item. There are permalinks to available pages. Highly useful for finding items that contain your keywords in its text.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eIt has the \u003ca href=\"http://tapor.ca/tools/314\"\u003eGoogle Ngram Viewer\u003c/a\u003e as part of its service. The Ngram Viewer is a service connected to Google Books that graphs the frequency of word usage across their book collection\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1262.jpg","creators_name":"Google Inc","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://books.google.com/","last_updated":"2021-06-23","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1262-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Google Books provides full, free PDF scans (and web-viewable versions) of public domain books and magazines, free previews of some books and magazines under copyright, and the option to purchase digital editions of available items to save and read on Google Play, their e-reading platform. You can also find a local library based on your zip code that has the item available. Reader reviews of the items are available and you can contribute your own. Search for authors, titles, as well as keywords and Google will return results with matches in the title/text of the item. There are permalinks to available pages. Highly useful for finding items that contain your keywords in its text.It has the Google Ngram Viewer as part of its service. The Ngram Viewer is a service connected to Google Books that graphs the frequency of word usage across their book collection
name: Google Books

detail:
Transformer loads Unicode text files and performs sequences of transformation operations on them — search-and-replace, or JavaScript operations. It provides you with an interface to create and test these sequences of transformations before running them in batch mode on a set of files.

Transformer was created to assist in the rescue of textual data from obsolete file formats such as DOS word-processor files. Sometimes, it proves impossible to rescue old data through normal means such as running the original application and exporting to a format which can be imported by a more modern program. Perhaps the program which created the data no longer exists or cannot be run on available hardware, or perhaps it cannot save to any format but its own. In these circumstances, it is often necessary to rescue the data by a process of manual conversion, identifying blocks of text or other data in the original file which can be replaced with Unicode characters, and building sequences of replacement operations which gradually convert the data. This often requires an exhaustive trial-and-error approach in which transformation operations are added incrementally and tested in various sequences before a reliable sequence is developed; then the sequence can be run on a group of files. Transformer should provide as efficient a working environment as possible, so that the user can focus on the task itself rather than the machinery.
name: Transformer: a Unicode Transform/Replace Tool

data_tapor:
{"id":1270,"user_id":1,"name":"Crowdmap","detail":"Crowdmap allows the investigator to set up a Web map around a particular topic and invite multiple users (participants, research subjects, collaborators, multiple assistants) to contribute information to the map on their own time and from their own device.

For $10/month, users can buy fee-based services including private maps and custom branding.

Users have complained that Crowdmap is glitchy and unreliable. It is hard to find recent examples of successful projects built with the app. There is no other free and open source tool that fills the precise niche. For a freemium closed source service that allows crowdsourced point data only, try ZeeMaps. For a fee-based, open source crowd mapping tool, try the shared tables function of CartoDB.

","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1270.jpg","creators_name":"Ushahidi","creators_email":null,"creators_url":"https://www.ushahidi.io","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://crowdmap.com","last_updated":"2018-09-18","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1270-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail:
Crowdmap allows the investigator to set up a Web map around a particular topic and invite multiple users (participants, research subjects, collaborators, multiple assistants) to contribute information to the map on their own time and from their own device.

For $10/month, users can buy  fee-based services including private maps and custom branding.
Users have complained that Crowdmap is glitchy and unreliable. It is hard to find recent examples of successful projects built with the app. There is no other free and open source tool that fills the precise niche. For a freemium closed source service that allows crowdsourced point data only, try ZeeMaps. For a fee-based, open source crowd mapping tool, try the shared tables function of CartoDB.
name: Crowdmap

data_tapor: {"id":1271,"user_id":1,"name":"Ushahidi Platform","detail":"\u003cp\u003eUshahidi is a software for information collection, visualization and interactive mapping, to build tools for democratizing information, increasing transparency and lowering the barriers for individuals to share their stories. It has been used for election monitoring, crisis and emergency response, civil society, city/community building, arts and even where to find the best burger. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSpecific tools: \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eCrowdmap: A simple map-making tool, built on an open API, that allows for collaborative mapping\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSwiftriver: Curate real-time data and analysis from a variety of sources, including social media streams\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eCrisisNET: A consolidated source of global crisis data\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003ePing: Two-way multichannel group alert during an emergency\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSMSSync: Create a two way gateway with an Android phone and local SIM anywhere in the world\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eBRCK: Supports connectivity in remote locations, self-powered, mobile WiFi device\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1271.jpg","creators_name":"Ushahidi","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.ushahidi.com/","last_updated":"2018-11-06","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1271-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Ushahidi is a software for information collection, visualization and interactive mapping, to build tools for democratizing information, increasing transparency and lowering the barriers for individuals to share their stories. It has been used for election monitoring, crisis and emergency response, civil society, city/community building, arts and even where to find the best burger. Specific tools: Crowdmap: A simple map-making tool, built on an open API, that allows for collaborative mappingSwiftriver: Curate real-time data and analysis from a variety of sources, including social media streamsCrisisNET: A consolidated source of global crisis dataPing: Two-way multichannel group alert during an emergencySMSSync: Create a two way gateway with an Android phone and local SIM anywhere in the worldBRCK: Supports connectivity in remote locations, self-powered, mobile WiFi device
name: Ushahidi

data_tapor: {"id":1272,"user_id":1,"name":"Tofu","detail":"\u003cp\u003eTofu reformats text into columns for easier reading. Tofu is basically a column-oriented text reader. Basically, Tofu will work with text (pasted, grabbed via a service, or in an opened file) and reformat it to display in multiple columns, all fully justified. This can make reading long, text-heavy documents much easier. Each column is only as high as your window and this eliminates the need to scroll vertically and the reader is less likely to loose track.\n Currently only available for mac os\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1272.jpg","creators_name":"Amar Sagoo","creators_email":"contact@amarsagoo.info","creators_url":"https://twitter.com/amar_designer","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://amarsagoo.info/tofu/","last_updated":"2020-10-23","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1272-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail:
Tofu reformats text into columns for easier reading. Tofu is basically a column-oriented text reader. Basically, Tofu will work with text (pasted, grabbed via a service, or in an opened file) and reformat it to display in multiple columns, all fully justified. This can make reading long, text-heavy documents much easier. Each column is only as high as your window and this eliminates the need to scroll vertically and the reader is less likely to loose track.
 Currently only available for mac os

detail: Lemon8-XML helps authors convert scholarly papers from word processor formats (e.g. .doc, .odt) into XML-based formats  web-based application designed to make it easier for non-technical editors and authors to convert scholarly papers from typical word-processor editing formats such as MS-Word .DOC and OpenOffice .ODT, into the XML-based publishing layout formats expected by Open Journal Systems.
name: Lemon8-XML

data_tapor: {"id":1286,"user_id":1,"name":"Bamboo Person Service","detail":"\u003cp\u003eThe Bamboo Person Service can help scholars access all the resources (tools, collections, and shared data) they have permissions for due to their institutional affiliations, scholarly society membership, association with research groups, etc. By connecting accounts from these different groups (e.g. a Google account for a research group, a university ID, and a generic username for a scholarly society), scholars will be able to use resources provided by any of these groups, in any work space or tool environment within the Bamboo ecosystem. Where previously research groups would have to agree on a single environment to work collaboratively and share their data, the Bamboo Person Service can allow group leaders to indicate which scholars in the Bamboo Person Service should have access to a set of data, which will then become accessible for each of those people in the environment of their choosing.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThe Bamboo Person Service also provides mechanisms for making contributions to projects easier to document (e.g. to present to tenure and review committees), by keeping track of which individuals are doing curation work on corpora, or contributing entries to Bamboo DiRT. As the Bamboo Person Service develops, it may be integrated with social and scholarly networking sites, to allow scholars to opt into sharing the tools they use, as part of their profile.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFor tool developers and collection holders, the Bamboo Person Service can reduce the time and development effort that would go into writing custom authentication and authorization, and can facilitate quality control in crowdsourced projects by keeping track of the curator assessments made about the validity of individual users' additions.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1286.jpg","creators_name":"Project Bamboo","creators_email":"hazelton@wisc.edu","creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.projectbamboo.org/","last_updated":"2020-10-23","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"http://svn.code.sf.net/p/projectbamboo/code/","thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1286-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: The Bamboo Person Service can help scholars access all the resources (tools, collections, and shared data) they have permissions for due to their institutional affiliations, scholarly society membership, association with research groups, etc. By connecting accounts from these different groups (e.g. a Google account for a research group, a university ID, and a generic username for a scholarly society), scholars will be able to use resources provided by any of these groups, in any work space or tool environment within the Bamboo ecosystem. Where previously research groups would have to agree on a single environment to work collaboratively and share their data, the Bamboo Person Service can allow group leaders to indicate which scholars in the Bamboo Person Service should have access to a set of data, which will then become accessible for each of those people in the environment of their choosing.The Bamboo Person Service also provides mechanisms for making contributions to projects easier to document (e.g. to present to tenure and review committees), by keeping track of which individuals are doing curation work on corpora, or contributing entries to Bamboo DiRT. As the Bamboo Person Service develops, it may be integrated with social and scholarly networking sites, to allow scholars to opt into sharing the tools they use, as part of their profile.For tool developers and collection holders, the Bamboo Person Service can reduce the time and development effort that would go into writing custom authentication and authorization, and can facilitate quality control in crowdsourced projects by keeping track of the curator assessments made about the validity of individual users' additions.
name: Bamboo Person Service

data_tapor: {"id":1287,"user_id":1,"name":"Bamboo Content Interoperability Hub","detail":"\u003cp\u003eThe Bamboo Content Interoperability Hub (CI gub) is an effort to largely automate the time-consuming process of downloading and compiling data from different repositories and archives and standardizing some of the format differences.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWhen scholars browse the repositories whose content they want (and have rights to) use, they can bookmark it at the proper level of granularity in Zotero, and import those Zotero bookmarks into a workspace integrated with the CI hub. The CI hub then retrieves the data, and normalizes it to a certain extent so that data from different sources can be used together. The CI hub also offers a \"preview\" tool to see what data has been ingested, before that data is handed off to the environment where the scholar will use it. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThe CI hub currently has adaptors to draw data from TCP-EEBO/ECO, Hathi Trust, Perseus, and AustLit.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1287.jpg","creators_name":"Project Bamboo","creators_email":"hazelton@wisc.edu","creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.projectbamboo.org/","last_updated":"2020-10-23","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"http://svn.code.sf.net/p/projectbamboo/code/","thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1287-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: The Bamboo Content Interoperability Hub (CI gub) is an effort to largely automate the time-consuming process of downloading and compiling data from different repositories and archives and standardizing some of the format differences.When scholars browse the repositories whose content they want (and have rights to) use, they can bookmark it at the proper level of granularity in Zotero, and import those Zotero bookmarks into a workspace integrated with the CI hub. The CI hub then retrieves the data, and normalizes it to a certain extent so that data from different sources can be used together. The CI hub also offers a "preview" tool to see what data has been ingested, before that data is handed off to the environment where the scholar will use it. The CI hub currently has adaptors to draw data from TCP-EEBO/ECO, Hathi Trust, Perseus, and AustLit.
name: Bamboo Content Interoperability Hub

detail:
VoiceWalker is a transcriber's tool, designed to help you transcribe audio or video recordings. VoiceWalker lets you play back the sound in a controlled way, with the benefit of being able to systematically step (or "walk") through a recording, repeating short segments for a specified number of repetitions, then moving on to the next segment. The segments overlap, so that the transcriber does not become disoriented.

VoiceWalker assumes that you have digitized your recordings as computer files to work with them more easily (for information on how to digitize, see the VoiceWalker manual).

VoiceWalker is free, available for Windows only.
name: VoiceWalker

detail:
Toolbox is a data management and analysis tool for field linguists. It is especially useful for maintaining lexical data, and for parsing and interlinearizing text, but it can be used to manage virtually any kind of data. Toolbox is free to download and use.

Toolbox is especially powerful for handling large corpora and dictionaries. It can handle a corpus of over a million words, and a dictionary of hundreds of thousands of words
At heart, Toolbox is a text-oriented database management system (DBMS) with added functionality designed to meet the needs of a field linguist. The underlying DBMS offers full user flexibility in the design of any type of database. But for ease of use, the Toolbox package includes prepared database definitions for a typical dictionary and text corpus. Toolbox also has powerful linguistic functionality. It includes a morphological parser that can handle almost all types of morphophonemic processes. It has a word formula component that allows the linguist to describe all the possible affix patterns that occur in words. It has a user-definable interlinear text generation system which uses the morphological parser and lexicon to generate annotated text
name: The Field Linguist’s Toolbox

data_tapor: {"id":1301,"user_id":1,"name":"ScrapBook","detail":"\u003cp\u003eScrapBook is a Firefox extension, which helps you to save Web pages and easily manage collections. detail: ScrapBook is a Firefox extension, which helps you to save Web pages and easily manage collections. Major features are:* Save Web page* Save snippet of Web page* Save Web site* Organize the collection in the same way as Bookmarks* Full text search and quick filtering search of the collection* Editing of the collected Web page* Text/HTML edit feature resembling Opera's Notes

data_tapor: {"id":1302,"user_id":1,"name":"Freebase","detail":"\u003cp\u003eFreebase was \"an open, Creative Commons Attribution (aka CC-BY) licensed collection of structured data,\" and a \"platform for accessing and manipulating that data\" via API. Almost 40 million entities and assertions about those entities are stored within a graph database. The database was built by pulling in open data and relies on community contribution to stay updated. Freebase was part of the semantic web and emits Linked Open Data (via RDF) for all its entities.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1302.jpg","creators_name":"Google","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://developers.google.com/freebase/","last_updated":"2018-10-05","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1302-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Freebase was "an open, Creative Commons Attribution (aka CC-BY) licensed collection of structured data," and a "platform for accessing and manipulating that data" via API. Almost 40 million entities and assertions about those entities are stored within a graph database. The database was built by pulling in open data and relies on community contribution to stay updated. Freebase was part of the semantic web and emits Linked Open Data (via RDF) for all its entities.
name: Freebase

data_tapor: {"id":1305,"user_id":1,"name":"Google Docs","detail":"\u003cp\u003eGoogle Docs is an online environment for editing and sharing documents, spreadsheets, presentations, forms, drawings, and tables. Google Docs documents can be public or private, or shared with anyone with a Google account, e-mailed, or downloaded in various formats, including conversions to PDF and other formats not identical to the original or to the proprietary format used at creation. Designated people with whom items are shared can be given permission to comment or edit the files, thus providing a quick way to collaborate on creating and editing documents and presentations.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1305.jpg","creators_name":"Google","creators_email":null,"creators_url":"http://www.google.com","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.google.ca/docs/about/","last_updated":"2018-10-17","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1305-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Google Docs is an online environment for editing and sharing documents, spreadsheets, presentations, forms, drawings, and tables. Google Docs documents can be public or private, or shared with anyone with a Google account, e-mailed, or downloaded in various formats, including conversions to PDF and other formats not identical to the original or to the proprietary format used at creation. Designated people with whom items are shared can be given permission to comment or edit the files, thus providing a quick way to collaborate on creating and editing documents and presentations.
name: Google Docs

data_tapor: {"id":1308,"user_id":1,"name":"KORA","detail":"\u003cp\u003eKORA is an open-source, database-driven, online digital repository application for complex multimedia objects (text, images, audio, video) created by MATRIX. KORA's flexible architecture can accommodate any metadata scheme allowing for individualized digital collections with differing contents and metadata structures.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1308.jpg","creators_name":"Anthony Donofrio, Jaquint, Jacob Newsted, Seila Gonzalez Estrecha, sucko, Zachery Schlemmer, QIJUN, Dianna Lynne Kay, Greenjam94, Tim Miller, nicolel93, Ramata Koumare, Tyler Erskine, Ryan R Zahm","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"http://kora.matrix.msu.edu/promo_index.php","last_updated":"2018-10-19","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"https://github.com/matrix-msu/kora2","thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1308-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: KORA is an open-source, database-driven, online digital repository application for complex multimedia objects (text, images, audio, video) created by MATRIX. The application ingests, manages, and delivers digital objects with corresponding metadata that enhances the research and educational value of the objects. KORA's flexible architecture can accommodate any metadata scheme allowing for individualized digital collections with differing contents and metadata structures.
name: KORA

data_tapor: {"id":1329,"user_id":1,"name":"pachyderm","detail":"\u003cp\u003ePachyderm is a web-based rich-media interactive presentation authoring and publishing system that meets most accessibility requirements. It works off of an extensible template system. Pachyderm allows users to upload multimedia (images, audio, video) and publish them online using pre-defined templates or download them for use on their own website, or on a CD or DVD. Version 3 (released June 2014) now also supports iOS and other non-Flash devices using HTML5, and appears to be a major upgrade. Requires Apache HTTP or Tomcat web server installation (WAMP or MAMP is fine).\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003ePachyForge is a community owned and operated Web site designed to improve communications and promote growth within the Pachyderm open source community. The site is intended serve both Pachyderm developers and end-users in sharing ideas and supporting one another. [from the site]. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eEDITOR's NOTE: Unfortunately, this site seems to have fallen behind, and does not cover the newest release, Version 3. However, it may contain useful links, documentation, and other resources.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1329.jpg","creators_name":"San Francisco Museum of Modern Art (SFMOMA), The New Media Consortium (NMC), Clayton Black, Scott Sayre, David Risner, Gavin Eadie","creators_email":"","creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"http://www.pachyforge.org/","last_updated":"2018-09-18","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1329-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Pachyderm is a web-based rich-media interactive presentation authoring and publishing system that meets most accessibility requirements. It works off of an extensible template system. Pachyderm allows users to upload multimedia (images, audio, video) and publish them online using pre-defined templates or download them for use on their own website, or on a CD or DVD. Version 3 (released June 2014) now also supports iOS and other non-Flash devices using HTML5, and appears to be a major upgrade. Requires Apache HTTP or Tomcat web server installation (WAMP or MAMP is fine).PachyForge is a community owned and operated Web site designed to improve communications and promote growth within the Pachyderm open source community. The site is intended serve both Pachyderm developers and end-users in sharing ideas and supporting one another. [from the site]. EDITOR's NOTE: Unfortunately, this site seems to have fallen behind, and does not cover the newest release, Version 3. However, it may contain useful links, documentation, and other resources.
name: pachyderm

data_tapor: {"id":1331,"user_id":1,"name":"Recollection","detail":"\u003cp\u003eRecollection was a platform developed by Zepheira for the Library of Congress National Digital Information Infrastructure and Preservation Program (NDIIPP), allowing users to create and share embeddable interfaces to digital cultural heritage collections. The Library of Congress released its latest version of Recollection as Viewshare, built to increase the ease of finding, using, and sharing the project's software. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eRecollection incorporates a series of web-based open standards and open source tools, including RDF, Simile Exhibit, Akara, and Django.\u003c/p\u003e\n\nRecollection is no longer supported.","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1331.jpg","creators_name":"Library of Congress, Zepheira","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":null,"last_updated":"2018-10-17","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1331-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail:
Recollection was a platform developed by Zepheira for the Library of Congress National Digital Information Infrastructure and Preservation Program (NDIIPP), allowing users to create and share embeddable interfaces to digital cultural heritage collections. The Library of Congress released its latest version of Recollection as Viewshare, built to increase the ease of finding, using, and sharing the project's software. Recollection incorporates a series of web-based open standards and open source tools, including RDF, Simile Exhibit, Akara, and Django.

Recollection is no longer supported.
name: Recollection

detail:
ZeeMaps quickly maps point data on Google base maps in two ways:

1) The user uploads a .csv file of data points and their locations.

2) A group of users all add their own data location points to the map, on their own time from their own devices.

Each point can include text, video, image, or audio annotations.

Basic functionality is free; larger uploads and large numbers of maps require a paid subscription.

detail:

Exhibit lets you easily create Web pages with advanced text search and filtering functionalities, with interactive maps, timelines, and other visualizations. The Exhibit 3.0 software has two separate modes: Scripted for building smaller in-browser Exhibits, and Staged for bigger server-based Exhibits.

data_tapor: {"id":1343,"user_id":1,"name":"ColorBrewer","detail":"\u003cp\u003eColorBrewer is a web tool for selecting color schemes for thematic maps, most usually for choropleth maps. It includes 35 basic schemes with different numbers of classes for over 250 possible versions. Each scheme has CMYK, RGB, Hex, Lab, and AV3 (HSV) specs for the colors. The software is designed simply to list color specs for a scheme you find useful so you are able to create these colors in the mapping software you are using.  \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eIt should be noted that ColorBrewer is not mapping software. It is designed specifically for users to look up color sets to use in mapping environments. It does not allow you to read in your own data and it will not open any other geography files.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1343.jpg","creators_name":"Cynthia Brewer, Mark Harrower, The Pennsylvania State University Support","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":null,"last_updated":null,"nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1343-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: ColorBrewer is a web tool for selecting color schemes for thematic maps, most usually for choropleth maps. It includes 35 basic schemes with different numbers of classes for over 250 possible versions. Each scheme has CMYK, RGB, Hex, Lab, and AV3 (HSV) specs for the colors. The software is designed simply to list color specs for a scheme you find useful so you are able to create these colors in the mapping software you are using.  It should be noted that ColorBrewer is not mapping software. It is designed specifically for users to look up color sets to use in mapping environments. It does not allow you to read in your own data and it will not open any other geography files.
name: ColorBrewer
